column4: i'm getting some strange behaviour, when i logout sometimes the computer screen just goes black and doesn't respond to anything, i end up having to turn power off manually
can you post the output of lspci in pastebin please. You may be experiencing something known as a kernel panic. Does the num lock caps lock and scroll lock keys flash when this has happened?
can i have your computer model and manafacturer please?
do you need the information to report a bug or to help me
to help you am currently looking for any of your hardware that may have issues with ubuntu. Can I also have your dmesg output please
do you have many externel usb or PCMCIA devices plugged into your computer often. Like a externel hdd or usb wireless modem?
It doesn't happen all the time, occasionally when i log off or ctrl alt backspace
okay try the boot option "irqpoll" and hope it doesn't happen again. If it does than come back to #ubuntu

in your dmesg output there were some irq discovery errors. irqpoll will hopefully fix or stop the part of the system which handles IRQ entries and is messing up. It will not cause anything to be disabled that would hamper performance or anything else neccesary
how do I set it so it runs
you need to edit your menu.lst
I know how to edit it but not sure where it is located
